Posts.EditableText: I have a escape sequence with a timer set up to it. For each second, a number is displayed as a frame picture. However, in the game only the first picture loads and the others display a generic picture icon. I'm pretty sure size isn't the problem as I used a compressor to make them under 1kb. Is there a way to fix this? Maybe a way to preload the images?
Posts.HTML: I have a escape sequence with a timer set up to it. For each second, a number is displayed as a frame picture. However, in the game only the first picture loads and the others display a generic picture icon. I'm pretty sure size isn't the problem as I used a compressor to make them under 1kb. Is there a way to fix this? Maybe a way to preload the images?

Posts.EditableText: I might be wrong here, but in my experience a broken picture link means you're calling a saved picture to Quest but it is not saved on your computer as that name.  With X2, I got a bunch of those after I resized my pictures and changed their names.  Double check that. Or maybe I don't understand your problem?  Let us know.
Posts.HTML: I might be wrong here, but in my experience a broken picture link means you're calling a saved picture to Quest but it is not saved on your computer as that name.  With X2, I got a bunch of those after I resized my pictures and changed their names.  Double check that. Or maybe I don't understand your problem?  Let us know.

Posts.EditableText:
[quote="XanMag":2er9jd64]I might be wrong here, but in my experience a broken picture link means you're calling a saved picture to Quest but it is not saved on your computer as that name.  With X2, I got a bunch of those after I resized my pictures and changed their names.  Double check that. Or maybe I don't understand your problem?  Let us know.[/quote:2er9jd64]
Thanks for helping, after further investigation of the picture names, I found that the extension was capitalized in Quest (.PNG) while the actual extension of the pictures were not capitalized. (.png)
Didn't know that icon meant it was a broken picture.
